title: 109_s121
content: DEATH GRATUITIES PAYABLE WITH RESPECT TO DECEASED MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES. Increased death gratuity amount from $12,000 to $100,000 under Section 1478(a) of title 10, US Code. Additional death gratuity payable to dependent children under 18 years old, with an extra payment when they reach 21 years of age. The death gratuity payable to a child of a deceased person under section 1477(e) of title 10, US Code shall be $25,000. Conforming amendments include changes to section 1477(d) regarding receiving payment of a death gratuity. The death gratuity under section 1477(e) of title 10, US Code shall be $25,000 and amendments to section 1479 are made. The effective date for these changes is October 1, 2001, with an exception for an amendment effective on October 28, 2004. SEC. 2. INCREASED PERIOD OF CONTINUED TRICARE COVERAGE FOR CHILDREN OF DECEASED UNIFORMED SERVICE MEMBERS ON ACTIVE DUTY FOR OVER 30 DAYS. Section 1079(g) of title 10, United States Code is amended to extend eligibility for benefits to dependents of deceased members on active duty for more than 30 days. Dependents receiving benefits under a covered plan shall continue to be eligible for three years after the member's death, or until the child reaches 21 years of age, whichever is longer. The amendment extends benefits to dependents of deceased members on active duty for more than 30 days. Dependents can receive benefits until the child reaches 21 years of age, or up to age 23 if enrolled in a full-time course of study in an institution of higher education approved by the administering Secretary. The amendment extends benefits to dependents of deceased members on active duty for more than 30 days, allowing coverage for children during the transition period between secondary school and higher education. No charges can be imposed for benefits coverage during this period. Effective as of October 1, 2001, the amendment applies to deaths occurring on or after that date. SEC. 3. Increase and enhancement of dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. Section 1311 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to increase dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses. This includes a monthly rate of $1,500, with additional provisions for remarried spouses and those with dependent children. The amendment to Section 1311 of title 38, United States Code increases dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses with dependent children under the age of 18. The monthly compensation for a surviving spouse with children is increased by $750 per child. The increase in compensation ceases once all children reach the age of 18, except for certain circumstances. The amendments to Section 1311 of title 38, United States Code increase dependency and indemnity compensation for surviving spouses with dependent children under 18. The amendments take effect on October 1, 2001, and apply to months starting on or after that date. Expansion and enhancement of survivors' and dependents' educational assistance is addressed in Section 4. Termination of Durational Limitation on Use of Educational Assistance: Amends section 3511 of title 38, United States Code, to allow educational assistance payments for individuals on active duty without affecting entitlement. Amends sections of title 10 to address interruptions in pursuit of educational programs for veterans. Amends sections of title 10 to address interruptions in pursuit of educational programs for veterans, including special restorative training and extending the delimiting age of eligibility for dependents. Amends section 3532 of title 38, increasing the aggregate amount of educational assistance to $80,000 for eligible individuals. Educational assistance can be used for institutional courses or full-time programs including training in a business or industrial establishment. The educational assistance program under section 3532 of title 38 includes various options for eligible individuals, such as institutional courses, farm cooperative programs, special educational assistance courses, apprenticeship or on-job training programs. The educational assistance program under section 3532 of title 38 offers options like institutional courses, farm cooperative programs, special educational assistance courses, apprenticeship, or on-job training programs. Eligible individuals can also receive assistance for correspondence education, special restorative training, and licensing or certification tests. Assistance for education in the Republic of the Philippines is paid at a rate of $0.50 for each dollar. The educational assistance program under section 3532 of title 38 provides various options for eligible individuals, including institutional courses, apprenticeship programs, and licensing tests. Payment for educational assistance for tests cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement. Conforming amendments have been made to sections 3533, 3534, and 3542 of the title. Amendments are made to various sections of title 38, including changes to educational assistance allowances and rates payable. Section 3565(b)(1) is also amended regarding educational assistance under section 3532. Amendments to title 38 include changes to educational assistance allowances and rates. Section 3687 is amended to specify payment rates and eligibility criteria. Amendments to title 38, under the Veterans Earn and Learn Act of 2004, involve changes to educational assistance allowances. Section 3524 and 3531 are amended to remove references to "allowance", and section 3537(a) is adjusted by removing "additional". Amendments to title 38 involve changes to educational assistance allowances, including removing references to "allowance" in sections 3524 and 3531, and adjusting section 3537(a) by removing "additional". Amendments to title 38 involve changes to educational assistance allowances, including updates to sections 3531, 3532, and 3533, as well as the removal of sections 3534 and 3541. The amendments to title 38 involve changes to educational assistance allowances, with effective dates specified for different subsections. The first increase in educational assistance under section 3532 is required for fiscal year 2006.
